Sentencas: The potential of a new anode cermet based on Cu and titania doped yttria stabilized zirconia (YZT) for high temperature fuel cells was examined.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Cermets were prepared by a standard solid-state reaction using Y0.2Ti0.18Zr0.62O1.9 and CuO as starting materials.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Green pellets were sintered at 1000 degrees C for 10 hours resulting in sound pellets.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: These were successfully reduced in 5 % H-2 in Argon again yielding sound pellets with a porosity of 50 %.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: These were characterized by SEM, XRD and TGA methods and their conductivity measured by ac impedance and the 4 point DC method as a function of both temperature and oxygen partial pressure.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: On sintering there was evidence of a small amount of reaction between CuO and YZT.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: This resulted in a slight tetragonal distortion of YZT; however, most of the copper oxide was not incorporated into the zirconia.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: The cermet was sucessfully redox cycled and percolation was achieved when the copper composition exceeded 33 % of the volume.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Conductivity remains high under a wide range of oxygen partial pressures from the most reducing conditions up to 10(-4) atm O-2.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Electrochemical testing performed using three-electrode geometry showed good performance for hydrogen oxidation for temperatures up to 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: At higher temperatures up to 1000 degrees C copper was observed to be very mobile with considerable agglomeration of metallic copper particles.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Indeed in some instances there was a total segregation of copper from YZT resulting in a copper layer forming at the electrolyte interface with the outer layer of the electrode being essentially YZT.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: This agglomeration and migration of Cu led to a significant degradation in electrochemical performance with large increases in the series resistance and polarization resistance, especially under anodic bias.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Due to these segregation problems copper based cermets produced in this manner are not thought to be good candidates for fuel cell electrodes operating at 1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation and Characterization of Copper/Yttria Titania Zirconia Cermets for Use as Possible Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes
